byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Judge Ronald B Adrine rules that probable cause exists to charge Cleveland police officers Timothy Loehmann and Frank Garmback in death of 12-year-old boy Tamir Rice; findings add pressure to case in which prosecutors have so far declined to bring charges; Tamir's death in November 2014 was among string of killings of unarmed black males by police officers across country.
lead_paragraph: The judge, Ronald B. Adrine, also said he did not have the power to order the arrest of the two officers without a complaint being filed by a prosecutor.

headline.main: Cleveland Judge Finds Probable Cause to Charge Officers in Tamir Rice Death
headline.print_headline: Judge Finds Probable Cause to Charge Cleveland Officers in a Boy’s Death

snippet: The judge, Ronald B. Adrine, also said he did not have the power to order the arrest of the two officers without a complaint being filed by a prosecutor.
